intro: Oedera squarrosa, commonly known as the woolly oedera, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woolly stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically pink or white. Oedera squarrosa thrives in wetland habitats and is often found in marshy areas along the coastal regions of Florida and Georgia.
